sense.gloss: book, booklet, story book, pamphlet, notebook
separate volume, extra issue, supplement, additional volume, supplementary volume
tanzaku, long, narrow strip of paper on which Japanese poems are written (vertically)
one copy (of a book, magazine, etc.), one volume
imperial edict to confer nobility titles (in ancient China)
written work (esp. a bound text, as opposed to a scroll)
a text written entirely in kana
graphic novel (esp. one created between the 12th and 19th centuries)
notebook (for practicing kana, drawing pictures, etc.)
large or bulky book or volume
5-point card with a red tanzaku, red ribbon card
the three 5-point cards with ribbons (high-scoring meld)
5-point card with a blue tanzaku, blue ribbon card
scoring combination consisting of the three 5-point cards with blue tanzaku
accredited Chinese envoy to neighbouring kingdoms
bestowing peerage by imperial edict (in ancient China), document bestowing peerage
bound form (of a magazine or book; as opposed to a single sheet, scroll, etc.)
